posts.post_content:
I have an artifact-based standard deck and this card is pure gold. My favorite pairing with this card is [Etched Champion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Etched Champion). When metalcraft is active (easy to achieve in a deck with 25+ artifacts), I suddenly have a 4/4 beater with protection from all colors.
  
   
This card also helps boost the fragile [Steel Overseer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Steel Overseer).
  
   
I give the card a 4.5/5, simply because it can be game-breaking in an artifact deck.
posts.html:
I have an artifact-based standard deck and this card is pure gold. My favorite pairing with this card is Etched Champion. When metalcraft is active (easy to achieve in a deck with 25+ artifacts), I suddenly have a 4/4 beater with protection from all colors.

This card also helps boost the fragile Steel Overseer.

I give the card a 4.5/5, simply because it can be game-breaking in an artifact deck.

Posted By: stille_nacht (6/20/2011 7:41:18 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I've stating a long time now that the glorious anthem was too weak and too unspecific to be truly good. Back then, I've said that a card like [Day of Destiny](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Day of Destiny) is a MUCH better card, as well as [Muraganda Petroglyphs](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Muraganda Petroglyphs). But both cards had the problem that they weren't in the "pants down" slot (= casting cost 3).   
Tempered Steel fulfills all my dreams and is worth a deck-designing card. It doesn't break the game, nor does it make you win the game, but it's a static effect that puts some pressure onto the battlefield.  
  
I hope that R&D gets the message and prints more enchantments like this.
posts.html:
I've stating a long time now that the glorious anthem was too weak and too unspecific to be truly good. Back then, I've said that a card like Day of Destiny is a MUCH better card, as well as Muraganda Petroglyphs. But both cards had the problem that they weren't in the "pants down" slot (= casting cost 3).
Tempered Steel fulfills all my dreams and is worth a deck-designing card. It doesn't break the game, nor does it make you win the game, but it's a static effect that puts some pressure onto the battlefield.

I hope that R&D gets the message and prints more enchantments like this.
